paragraph.target: 老人が星を見て判断する限り、その夜魚はコースも方向も変えなかった。

paragraph.source: It was cold after the sun went down and the old man's sweat dried cold on his back and his arms and his old legs.
paragraph.target: 太陽が沈んだ後は寒くなり、老人の汗は背中や腕、老いた脚に冷たく乾いた。

paragraph.source: During the day he had taken the sack that covered the bait box and spread it in the sun to dry.
paragraph.target: 昼間、彼は餌箱を覆っていた袋を取り、日光に干した。

paragraph.source: After the sun went down he tied it around his neck so that it hung down over his back and he cautiously worked it down under the line that was across his shoulders now.
paragraph.target: 太陽が沈んだ後、彼はそれを首に巻きつけ、背中に垂らし、慎重に肩にかかっている綱の下に差し込んだ。

paragraph.source: The sack cushioned the line and he had found a way of leaning forward against the bow so that he was almost comfortable.
paragraph.target: 袋が綱をクッションし、彼は前かがみになって船首に寄りかかる方法を見つけ、ほぼ快適な状態になった。

paragraph.source: The position actually was only somewhat less intolerable; but he thought of it as almost comfortable.
paragraph.target: その姿勢は実際には少しは我慢できるものだったが、彼はそれをほぼ快適だと考えた。

paragraph.source: I can do nothing with him and he can do nothing with me, he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼と私は何もできない。彼がこのまま続ける限り、私たちは何もできないと老人は考えた。

paragraph.source: Not as long as he keeps this up.
paragraph.target: 彼がこのまま続ける限り。

paragraph.source: Once he stood up and urinated over the side of the skiff and looked at the stars and checked his course.
paragraph.target: 老人は立ち上がって船の側から尿をして星を見て航路を確認した。

paragraph.source: The line showed like a phosphorescent streak in the water straight out from his shoulders.
paragraph.target: 糸は彼の肩から真っ直ぐに水中に光る線として現れていた。

paragraph.source: They were moving more slowly now and the glow of Havana was not so strong, so that he knew the current must be carrying them to the eastward.
paragraph.target: 今や彼らはよりゆっくりと動いており、ハバナの光もそこまで強くなかったので、彼は流れが彼らを東に運んでいることを知っていた。

paragraph.source: If I lose the glare of Havana we must be going more to the eastward, he thought.
paragraph.target: ハバナの輝きが見失えば、私たちはもっと東に向かっているはずだ、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: For if the fish's course held true I must see it for many more hours.
paragraph.target: なぜなら、もし魚の進路が正しいなら、私はそれをもっと多くの時間見続けなければならないだろう。

paragraph.source: I wonder how the baseball came out in the grand leagues today, he thought.
paragraph.target: 今日のメジャーリーグの野球の結果はどうだったのだろう、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: It would be wonderful to do this with a radio.
paragraph.target: ラジオを持っていたら素晴らしいだろう。

paragraph.source: Then he thought, think of it always.
paragraph.target: そして彼は考えた、いつもそれを考えろ。

paragraph.source: Think of what you are doing.
paragraph.target: 自分がしていることを考えろ。

paragraph.source: You must do nothing stupid.
paragraph.target: 愚かなことはしてはいけない。

paragraph.source: Then he said aloud, “I wish I had the boy. To help me and to see this.”
paragraph.target: そして彼は声に出して言った。「少年がいればなあ。助けてくれて、これを見てくれるのになあ。」

paragraph.source: No one should be alone in their old age, he thought.
paragraph.target: 老後、誰も一人になるべきではないと彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: But it is unavoidable.
paragraph.target: しかし、それは避けられない。

paragraph.source: I must remember to eat the tuna before he spoils in order to keep strong.
paragraph.target: 強くいるために、大物が腐らないうちにマグロを食べることを覚えておかなければならない。

paragraph.source: Remember, no matter how little you want to, that you must eat him in the morning.
paragraph.target: どんなにしたくなくても、朝には彼を食べなければならないことを覚えておくのだ。

paragraph.source: Remember, he said to himself.
paragraph.target: 覚えておけ、彼は自分に言った。

paragraph.source: During the night two porpoise came around the boat and he could hear them rolling and blowing.
paragraph.target: 夜になると、2匹のイルカが船の周りに現れ、彼は彼らが転がり、吹く音を聞くことができた。

paragraph.source: He could tell the difference between the blowing noise the male made and the sighing blow of the female.
paragraph.target: 彼は、オスが出す吹く音とメスのため息交じりの吹き音との違いを感じ取ることができた。

paragraph.source: “They are good,” he said. “They play and make jokes and love one another. They are our brothers like the flying fish.”
paragraph.target: 「彼らは良い」と彼は言った。「彼らは遊び、冗談を言い合い、お互いを愛している。彼らは飛ぶ魚のように私たちの兄弟だ」。

paragraph.source: Then he began to pity the great fish that he had hooked.
paragraph.target: そして、彼は釣り上げた偉大な魚を哀れんだ。

paragraph.source: He is wonderful and strange and who knows how old he is, he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼は素晴らしく奇妙で、年を取っているかどうかもわからない、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: Never have I had such a strong fish nor one who acted so strangely.
paragraph.target: こんなに強い魚や、こんなに奇妙に振る舞う魚はかつていなかった。

paragraph.source: Perhaps he is too wise to jump.
paragraph.target: おそらく彼は飛び跳ねるのは賢明ではないと思っている。

paragraph.source: He could ruin me by jumping or by a wild rush.
paragraph.target: 彼は飛び跳ねることや猛烈な突進で私を台無しにできるだろう。

paragraph.source: But perhaps he has been hooked many times before and he knows that this is how he should make his fight.
paragraph.target: でも、もしかしたら彼は以前に何度も釣り上げられており、これが彼が戦うべき方法だと知っているのかもしれない。

paragraph.source: He cannot know that it is only one man against him, nor that it is an old man.
paragraph.target: 彼はただ1人の男と対峙していること、そしてその男が老人であることを知るはずがない。

paragraph.source: But what a great fish he is and what he will bring in the market if the flesh is good.
paragraph.target: しかし、彼はどれほど偉大な魚であり、もし肉が美味しければ市場でどれほどの価値を持つだろうか。

paragraph.source: He took the bait like a male and he pulls like a male and his fight has no panic in it.
paragraph.target: 彼はオスのように餌を食べ、引っ張る。そして彼の戦いにはパニックがない。

paragraph.source: I wonder if he has any plans or if he is just as desperate as I am?
paragraph.target: 彼には計画があるのか、それとも私と同じくらい絶望的なのか、と私は思う。

paragraph.source: He remembered the time he had hooked one of a pair of marlin.
paragraph.target: 彼は、マーリンの一対を釣り上げた時を思い出した。

paragraph.source: The male fish always let the female fish feed first and the hooked fish, the female, made a wild, panic-stricken, despairing fight that soon exhausted her, and all the time the male had stayed with her, crossing the line and circling with her on the surface.
paragraph.target: オスの魚はいつもメスの魚に最初に餌を食べさせ、釣り上げられた魚、つまりメスは、すぐに疲れ果てるほどの荒々しく、パニックに陥った、絶望的な戦いを繰り広げた。その間、オスは彼女と一緒にいて、ラインを横切り、表面で彼女と一緒に円を描いていた。

paragraph.source: He had stayed so close that the old man was afraid he would cut the line with his tail which was sharp as a scythe and almost of that size and shape.
paragraph.target: オスはあまりにも近くにいたため、老人は彼が尾でラインを切ってしまうのではないかと心配していた。その尾は鎌のように鋭く、その大きさと形状もほぼ同じだった。

paragraph.source: When the old man had gaffed her and clubbed her, holding the rapier bill with its sandpaper edge and clubbing her across the top of her head until her colour turned to a colour almost like the backing of mirrors, and then, with the boy's aid, hoisted her aboard, the male fish had stayed by the side of the boat.
paragraph.target: 老人が彼女をガフで引き寄せ、棒で殴り、研ぎ澄まされた刃と砂紙のような刃を持ち、彼女の頭の上を殴りつけ、彼女の色が鏡の裏地のような色に変わるまで、そして、少年の助けを借りて、彼女を船に引き上げた時、オスの魚は船の横にいた。

paragraph.source: Then, while the old man was clearing the lines and preparing the harpoon, the male fish jumped high into the air beside the boat to see where the female was and then went down deep, his lavender wings, that were his pectoral fins, spread wide and all his wide lavender stripes showing.
paragraph.target: その後、老人がラインを片付け、銛を準備している間、オスの魚は船の横で高く跳び上がり、メスがどこにいるかを見てから深く潜り、彼の薄紫の翼、それが胸びれである広がり、全ての広い薄紫の縞を見せた。

paragraph.source: He was beautiful, the old man remembered, and he had stayed.
paragraph.target: 彼は美しかった、老人は思い出した、そして彼はそのままいた。

paragraph.source: That was the saddest thing I ever saw with them, the old man thought.
paragraph.target: 老人は考えた。それは彼らと一緒に見た中で最も悲しいものだった。

paragraph.source: The boy was sad too and we begged her pardon and butchered her promptly.
paragraph.target: 少年も悲しかったし、私たちは彼女に謝罪し、速やかに解体した。

paragraph.source: “I wish the boy was here,” he said aloud and settled himself against the rounded planks of the bow and felt the strength of the great fish through the line he held across his shoulders moving steadily toward whatever he had chosen.
paragraph.target: 「少年がここにいてくれたらなあ」と彼は声に出して言い、船首の丸い板に身を預け、肩越しに引いている糸を通じて大きな魚の力を感じながら、彼が選んだ先に向かって着実に進んでいくのを感じた。

paragraph.source: When once, through my treachery, it had been necessary to him to make a choice, the old man thought.
paragraph.target: かつて、私の裏切りによって、彼に選択を迫られた時、老人は考えた。

paragraph.source: His choice had been to stay in the deep dark water far out beyond all snares and traps and treacheries.
paragraph.target: 彼の選択は、すべての罠やわな、裏切りを超えた遠くの暗い深海にとどまることだった。

paragraph.source: My choice was to go there to find him beyond all people.
paragraph.target: 私の選択は、彼を見つけるためにそこに行くことだった。すべての人々を超えて。

paragraph.source: Beyond all people in the world.
paragraph.target: 世界中のすべての人々を超えて。

paragraph.source: Now we are joined together and have been since noon.
paragraph.target: 今、私たちは結びついており、正午以来そうである。

paragraph.source: And no one to help either one of us.
paragraph.target: そして、私たちのどちらも助ける人はいない。

paragraph.source: Perhaps I should not have been a fisherman, he thought.
paragraph.target: もしかしたら、私は漁師になるべきではなかったのかもしれないと、彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: But that was the thing that I was born for.
paragraph.target: しかし、それが私が生まれた目的だった。

paragraph.source: I must surely remember to eat the tuna after it gets light.
paragraph.target: 明るくなったら、必ずマグロを食べることを覚えておかなければならない。

paragraph.source: Some time before daylight something took one of the baits that were behind him.
paragraph.target: 夜明け前、彼の後ろにあった餌の1つが何かに取られた。

paragraph.source: He heard the stick break and the line begin to rush out over the gunwale of the skiff.
paragraph.target: 彼は棒が折れる音と、ラインがスキフの舷側を駆け抜ける音を聞いた。

paragraph.source: In the darkness he loosened his sheath knife and taking all the strain of the fish on his left shoulder he leaned back and cut the line against the wood of the gunwale.
paragraph.target: 暗闇の中、彼はナイフを鞘から抜き、左肩に魚の引きを全て受け止めながら後ろに身を乗り出し、舷側の木に対してラインを切った。

paragraph.source: Then he cut the other line closest to him and in the dark made the loose ends of the reserve coils fast.
paragraph.target: そして、彼は自分に最も近いもう1本のラインを切り、暗闇の中で予備のコイルの緩んだ端をしっかりと縛った。

paragraph.source: He worked skillfully with the one hand and put his foot on the coils to hold them as he drew his knots tight.
paragraph.target: 彼は片手で巧みに作業し、結び目を引き締める際にコイルに足をかけて固定した。

paragraph.source: Now he had six reserve coils of line.
paragraph.target: 今、彼は予備のコイルを6つ持っていた。

paragraph.source: There were two from each bait he had severed and the two from the bait the fish had taken and they were all connected.
paragraph.target: 彼が切り離した各餌から2つずつ、そして魚が取った餌から2つがあり、それらはすべてつながっていた。

paragraph.source: After it is light, he thought, I will work back to the forty-fathom bait and cut it away too and link up the reserve coils.
paragraph.target: 明るくなったら、彼は考えた、40ファゾムの餌に戻って切り離し、予備のコイルをつなげるつもりだ。

paragraph.source: I will have lost two hundred fathoms of good Catalan cordel and the hooks and leaders. That can be replaced.
paragraph.target: 200ファゾムの良質なカタランコルデルとフック、リーダーを失うことになる。それらは代替できる。

paragraph.source: But who replaces this fish if I hook some fish and it cuts him off?
paragraph.target: しかし、もし魚を釣り上げても途中で逃がされたら、誰がこの魚を代わりに釣るのだろうか？

paragraph.source: I don't know what that fish was that took the bait just now. It could have been a marlin or a broadbill or a shark.
paragraph.target: さっき餌を食べたあの魚が何だったのか分からない。マーリンかカマスかサメかもしれない。

paragraph.source: I never felt him. I had to get rid of him too fast.
paragraph.target: 彼を感じることはなかった。あまりにも速く彼を逃がさなければならなかった。

paragraph.source: Aloud he said, “I wish I had the boy.”
paragraph.target: 彼は声に出して言った。「少年がいればいいのに」と。

paragraph.source: But you haven't got the boy, he thought.
paragraph.target: しかし、お前には少年がいない。と老人は考えた。

paragraph.source: You have only yourself and you had better work back to the last line now, in the dark or not in the dark, and cut it away and hook up the two reserve coils.
paragraph.target: お前には自分しかいない。今すぐ最後の釣り糸に戻って、暗闇の中でも明るい中でも、それを切り離して予備のコイルを繋ぎ直すべきだ。

paragraph.source: So he did it.
paragraph.target: そして彼はそれをやり遂げた。

paragraph.source: It was difficult in the dark and once the fish made a surge that pulled him down on his face and made a cut below his eye.
paragraph.target: 暗闇の中でそれは難しかった。そして一度、魚が急に引っ張り、彼を顔から引き倒し、目の下に切り傷を作った。

paragraph.source: The blood ran down his cheek a little way.
paragraph.target: 血が頬を少し伝っていった。

paragraph.source: But it coagulated and dried before it reached his chin and he worked his way back to the bow and rested against the wood.
paragraph.target: しかし、それはあごに達する前に凝固し、乾燥した。そして彼は船首に戻り、木に寄りかかった。

paragraph.source: He adjusted the sack and carefully worked the line so that it came across a new part of his shoulders and, holding it anchored with his shoulders, he carefully felt the pull of the fish and then felt with his hand the progress of the skiff through the water.
paragraph.target: 彼は袋を調整し、慎重に糸を操作して、それが肩の新しい部分を横切るようにした。そして、肩で固定しながら、魚の引っ張りを慎重に感じ、その後手でスキフが水を進む様子を感じた。

paragraph.source: I wonder what he made that lurch for, he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼は一体何のためにあんなに飛び出したのだろう、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: The wire must have slipped on the great hill of his back.
paragraph.target: 釣り糸が彼の背中の大きな丘で滑ったに違いない。

paragraph.source: Certainly his back cannot feel as badly as mine does.
paragraph.target: 確かに、彼の背中は私のようにひどくは感じないだろう。

paragraph.source: But he cannot pull this skiff forever, no matter how great he is.
paragraph.target: しかし、彼はどんなに偉大でも、永遠にこの小舟を引きずり続けることはできない。

paragraph.source: Now everything is cleared away that might make trouble and I have a big reserve of line; all that a man can ask.
paragraph.target: 今はトラブルを引き起こす可能性のあるものはすべて片付けられ、私はたくさんの予備の釣り糸を持っている。これ以上望むことはない。

paragraph.source: “Fish,” he said softly, aloud, “I'll stay with you until I am dead.”
paragraph.target: 「魚よ」と、彼は静かにつぶやいた。「私は死ぬまであなたと一緒にいるよ」。

paragraph.source: He'll stay with me too, I suppose, the old man thought and he waited for it to be light.
paragraph.target: 老人は、彼も私と一緒にいてくれるだろう、と考え、明るくなるのを待っていた。

paragraph.source: It was cold now in the time before daylight and he pushed against the wood to be warm.
paragraph.target: 夜明け前は寒かったが、老人は暖かくなるように木に寄りかかった。

paragraph.source: I can do it as long as he can, he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼ができる限り私もできる、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: And in the first light the line extended out and down into the water.
paragraph.target: そして最初の光が差すと、釣り糸は水中に伸びていった。

paragraph.source: The boat moved steadily and when the first edge of the sun rose it was on the old man's right shoulder.
paragraph.target: 小舟は着実に進み、太陽の最初の縁が昇ると、それは老人の右肩に差し込んだ。

paragraph.source: “He's headed north,” the old man said.
paragraph.target: 「北に向かっている」と老人は言った。

paragraph.source: The current will have set us far to the eastward, he thought.
paragraph.target: 流れは私たちをかなり東に押しやっているだろう、彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: I wish he would turn with the current.
paragraph.target: 彼が流れに逆らわずに進んでくれるといいのだが。

paragraph.source: That would show that he was tiring.
paragraph.target: それは彼が疲れてきていることを示すだろう。

paragraph.source: When the sun had risen further the old man realized that the fish was not tiring.
paragraph.target: 太陽がさらに昇ると、老人は魚が疲れていないことに気づいた。

paragraph.source: There was only one favorable sign.
paragraph.target: 好ましい兆候はただ1つだけだった。

paragraph.source: The slant of the line showed he was swimming at a lesser depth.
paragraph.target: 糸の傾きから、彼が浅い深度で泳いでいることがわかった。

paragraph.source: That did not necessarily mean that he would jump.
paragraph.target: それは必ずしも彼が飛ぶことを意味するわけではなかった。

paragraph.source: But he might.
paragraph.target: しかし、彼は飛ぶかもしれない。

paragraph.source: “God let him jump,” the old man said. “I have enough line to handle him.”
paragraph.target: 「神よ、彼に飛び跳ねるように許してくれ」と老人は言った。「彼を扱うのに十分な釣り糸がある」。

paragraph.source: Maybe if I can increase the tension just a little it will hurt him and he will jump, he thought.
paragraph.target: もし少し緊張を高めることができれば、彼を傷つけて飛び跳ねさせるかもしれないと彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: Now that it is daylight let him jump so that he'll fill the sacks along his backbone with air and then he cannot go deep to die.
paragraph.target: 今日中には明るくなるだろう。彼が飛び跳ねるようにして、背骨に沿って袋を空気で満たさせ、その後は深く潜って死ぬことができないようにしてくれ。

paragraph.source: He tried to increase the tension, but the line had been taut up to the very edge of the breaking point since he had hooked the fish and he felt the harshness as he leaned back to pull and knew he could put no more strain on it.
paragraph.target: 彼は緊張を高めようとしましたが、魚を釣り上げてからずっとラインは破断寸前まで張り詰められていました。彼は引っ張るために後ろに身を乗り出すときにその厳しさを感じ、これ以上負荷をかけることはできないと知っていました。

paragraph.source: I must not jerk it ever, he thought.
paragraph.target: 決して急に引っ張ってはいけない、と彼は考えました。

paragraph.source: Each jerk widens the cut the hook makes and then when he does jump he might throw it.
paragraph.target: 各急引きは針が作る切り傷を広げ、そして彼が飛び跳ねるときにはそれを投げてしまうかもしれない。

paragraph.source: Anyway I feel better with the sun and for once I do not have to look into it.
paragraph.target: とにかく、太陽の光を浴びると気分が良くなるし、一度も太陽を見つめる必要がない。

paragraph.source: There was yellow weed on the line but the old man knew that only made an added drag and he was pleased.
paragraph.target: 釣り糸には黄色い海草がついていたが、老人はそれが追加の引きずりを生むだけだと知って満足していた。

paragraph.source: It was the yellow Gulf weed that had made so much phosphorescence in the night.
paragraph.target: それは夜に多くの蛍光を生み出した黄色いメキシコ湾の海草だった。

paragraph.source: “Fish,” he said, “I love you and respect you very much.
paragraph.target: 「魚よ、お前を愛し、とても尊敬している」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: But I will kill you dead before this day ends.”
paragraph.target: しかし、この日が終わる前にお前を殺してやるだろう。」

paragraph.source: Let us hope so, he thought.
paragraph.target: そう願いたいものだ、彼は思った。

paragraph.source: A small bird came toward the skiff from the north.
paragraph.target: 小さな鳥が北からスキフに向かって飛んできた。

paragraph.source: He was a warbler and flying very low over the water.
paragraph.target: 彼はモズで、水面をとても低く飛んでいた。

paragraph.source: The old man could see that he was very tired.
paragraph.target: 老人は彼がとても疲れているのが分かった。

paragraph.source: The bird made the stern of the boat and rested there.
paragraph.target: その鳥は船の船尾にやってきてそこで休んだ。

paragraph.source: Then he flew around the old man's head and rested on the line where he was more comfortable.
paragraph.target: そして、その鳥は老人の頭の周りを飛び回り、自分がより快適だと感じる場所で休んだ。

paragraph.source: “How old are you?” the old man asked the bird.
paragraph.target: 「君は何歳なんだい？」と老人は鳥に尋ねた。

paragraph.source: “Is this your first trip?”
paragraph.target: 「これが君の初めての旅かい？」

paragraph.source: The bird looked at him when he spoke.
paragraph.target: 老人が話すと、鳥は彼を見ました。

paragraph.source: He was too tired even to examine the line and he teetered on it as his delicate feet gripped it fast.
paragraph.target: 彼は疲れすぎて糸を調べることさえできず、繊細な足がしっかりと糸をつかんでいる間、それに揺れ動いていました。

paragraph.source: “It's steady,” the old man told him.
paragraph.target: 「安定しているよ」と老人は彼に言った。

paragraph.source: “It's too steady.
paragraph.target: 「あまりにも安定している。

paragraph.source: You shouldn't be that tired after a windless night.
paragraph.target: 風のない夜の後でそんなに疲れてはいけない。

paragraph.source: What are birds coming to?”
paragraph.target: 鳥たちはどうなっているんだ？」

paragraph.source: The hawks, he thought, that come out to sea to meet them.
paragraph.target: 老人は、彼らに会いに海に出てくるタカのことを考えた。

paragraph.source: But he said nothing of this to the bird who could not understand him anyway and who would learn about the hawks soon enough.
paragraph.target: しかし、老人は、どちらにせよ自分を理解できない鳥にはこのことを何も言わなかった。そして、その鳥はやがてタカについて学ぶことになるだろう。

paragraph.source: “Take a good rest, small bird,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「ゆっくり休んでくれ、小さな鳥よ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “Then go in and take your chance like any man or bird or fish.”
paragraph.target: 「そして、どんな人間や鳥や魚と同じように、チャンスをつかんで行け」と。

paragraph.source: It encouraged him to talk because his back had stiffened in the night and it hurt truly now.
paragraph.target: 彼は話すことを奨励されました。夜に背中が凝って痛みを感じていたからです。

paragraph.source: “Stay at my house if you like, bird,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「好きなら、俺の家に泊まっていけ、小鳥」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “I am sorry I cannot hoist the sail and take you in with the small breeze that is rising.
paragraph.target: 「風が上がってきているけど、帆を揚げて君を乗せることはできないのが残念だ。

paragraph.source: But I am with a friend.”
paragraph.target: でも、友達と一緒だ」と。

paragraph.source: Just then the fish gave a sudden lurch that pulled the old man down onto the bow and would have pulled him overboard if he had not braced himself and given some line.
paragraph.target: その時、魚が突然激しく引っ張り、老人を船首に引き倒し、もし老人が身構えてラインを緩めていなかったら、彼は船外に引きずり落とされていただろう。

paragraph.source: The bird had flown up when the line jerked and the old man had not even seen him go.
paragraph.target: 老人がラインが引っ張られたときに鳥が飛び立ち、老人は彼が去ったのも見ていなかった。

paragraph.source: He felt the line carefully with his right hand and noticed his hand was bleeding.
paragraph.target: 彼は右手でラインを注意深く感じ、手が出血していることに気づいた。

paragraph.source: “Something hurt him then,” he said aloud and pulled back on the line to see if he could turn the fish.
paragraph.target: 「何かが彼を傷つけたのだろう」と彼は声に出して言い、魚を引き返してみた。

paragraph.source: But when he was touching the breaking point he held steady and settled back against the strain of the line.
paragraph.target: しかし、限界に触れたとき、彼はしっかりと立ち向かい、ラインの緊張に対して身を落ち着かせた。

paragraph.source: “You're feeling it now, fish,” he said. “And so, God knows, am I.”
paragraph.target: 「今、お前も感じているだろう、魚よ」と彼は言った。「そして、神のご存じの通り、私もだ」。

paragraph.source: He looked around for the bird now because he would have liked him for company.
paragraph.target: 今、彼は鳥を探し回った。なぜなら、彼はその鳥を仲間にしていたかったからだ。

paragraph.source: The bird was gone.
paragraph.target: しかし、鳥はもういなかった。

paragraph.source: You did not stay long, the man thought.
paragraph.target: 君は長くはいなかったな、男は思った。

paragraph.source: But it is rougher where you are going until you make the shore.
paragraph.target: だが、君が向かう先は、岸に着くまで荒れているだろう。

paragraph.source: How did I let the fish cut me with that one quick pull he made?
paragraph.target: 魚が一瞬の引きで僕を切らせてしまったのはどうしてだろう？

paragraph.source: I must be getting very stupid.
paragraph.target: 僕はとても愚かになっているのだろう。

paragraph.source: Or perhaps I was looking at the small bird and thinking of him.
paragraph.target: あるいは、僕は小さな鳥を見て彼のことを考えていたのかもしれない。

paragraph.source: Now I will pay attention to my work and then I must eat the tuna so that I will not have a failure of strength.
paragraph.target: さて、今からは仕事に集中し、そしてマグロを食べねばならない。そうすれば力尽きることはないだろう。

paragraph.source: “I wish the boy were here and that I had some salt,” he said aloud.
paragraph.target: 「少年がここにいて、塩があればいいのにな」と彼は声に出して言った。

paragraph.source: Shifting the weight of the line to his left shoulder and kneeling carefully he washed his hand in the ocean and held it there, submerged, for more than a minute watching the blood trail away and the steady movement of the water against his hand as the boat moved.
paragraph.target: 彼はラインの重さを左肩に移し、注意深くひざまずいて手を海に洗い、それを浸し続け、1分以上、血が流れ去るのを見ながら、船が動くにつれて水の静かな動きを手に感じた。

paragraph.source: “He has slowed much,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「彼はだいぶ遅くなったな」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: The old man would have liked to keep his hand in the salt water longer but he was afraid of another sudden lurch by the fish and he stood up and braced himself and held his hand up against the sun.
paragraph.target: 老人は手を塩水にもっと長くつけていたかったが、魚が突然また激しく引っ張ることを恐れ、立ち上がって身構え、手を太陽に向けていた。

paragraph.source: It was only a line burn that had cut his flesh.
paragraph.target: 彼の肉を切ったのはただのラインの焼けただれだった。

paragraph.source: But it was in the working part of his hand.
paragraph.target: しかし、それは彼の手の使う部分にできていた。

paragraph.source: He knew he would need his hands before this was over and he did not like to be cut before it started.
paragraph.target: 彼はこれが終わる前に手が必要になることを知っており、始まる前に傷つけられるのは好きではなかった。

paragraph.source: “Now,” he said, when his hand had dried, “I must eat the small tuna.
paragraph.target: 「さて」と彼は言った。手が乾いたところで、「小さなマグロを食べねばならん。

paragraph.source: I can reach him with the gaff and eat him here in comfort.”
paragraph.target: ガフで手に入れて、ここで快適に食べることができる」。

paragraph.source: He knelt down and found the tuna under the stern with the gaff and drew it toward him keeping it clear of the coiled lines.
paragraph.target: 老人はひざまずいてガフで船尾の下にあるマグロを見つけ、コイル状のラインに絡まらないように自分の方に引き寄せた。

paragraph.source: Holding the line with his left shoulder again, and bracing on his left hand and arm, he took the tuna off the gaff hook and put the gaff back in place.
paragraph.target: 再び左肩でラインを保持し、左手と腕で支えながら、老人はマグロをガフのフックから外し、ガフを元の位置に戻した。

paragraph.source: He put one knee on the fish and cut strips of dark red meat longitudinally from the back of the head to the tail.
paragraph.target: 老人は魚の上に片膝をつき、頭から尾までの暗赤色の肉を縦にストリップ状に切り取った。

paragraph.source: They were wedge-shaped strips and he cut them from next to the back bone down to the edge of the belly.
paragraph.target: それらはくさび形のストリップであり、老人はそれらを背骨の隣から腹部の端まで切り取った。

paragraph.source: When he had cut six strips he spread them out on the wood of the bow, wiped his knife on his trousers, and lifted the carcass of the bonito by the tail and dropped it overboard.
paragraph.target: 老人は6本のストリップを切り取ると、それらを船首の木の上に広げ、ナイフをズボンで拭い、カツオの死骸を尾ビレで持ち上げて船外に投げ捨てた。

paragraph.source: “I don't think I can eat an entire one,” he said and drew his knife across one of the strips.
paragraph.target: 「1匹丸ごとは食べられないと思うな」と彼は言い、ナイフを1本の切れ端に添えた。

paragraph.source: He could feel the steady hard pull of the line and his left hand was cramped.
paragraph.target: 彼は糸のしっかりとした引っ張りを感じ、左手がつり上がった。

paragraph.source: It drew up tight on the heavy cord and he looked at it in disgust.
paragraph.target: それは重い糸に引っ張られ、彼は嫌悪の表情でそれを見つめた。

paragraph.source: “What kind of a hand is that,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「何だ、そんな手は」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “Cramp then if you want.
paragraph.target: 「けん怠けるがいい。

paragraph.source: Make yourself into a claw.
paragraph.target: 自分をかぎづめに変えてみろ。

paragraph.source: It will do you no good.”
paragraph.target: 何の役にも立たないだろう」。

paragraph.source: Come on, he thought and looked down into the dark water at the slant of the line.
paragraph.target: さあ、彼は考えた。そして、暗い水面を見下ろし、ラインの傾きを見つめた。

paragraph.source: Eat it now and it will strengthen the hand.
paragraph.target: 今すぐ食べれば、手を強くするだろう。

paragraph.source: It is not the hand's fault and you have been many hours with the fish.
paragraph.target: 手のせいではない。そして、魚と長い時間を過ごしてきた。

paragraph.source: But you can stay with him forever.
paragraph.target: しかし、永遠に彼と一緒にいられる。

paragraph.source: Eat the bonito now.
paragraph.target: 今、カツオを食べよう。

paragraph.source: He picked up a piece and put it in his mouth and chewed it slowly.
paragraph.target: 彼は一片を手に取り、口に入れてゆっくりと噛んだ。

paragraph.source: It was not unpleasant.
paragraph.target: それは悪くなかった。

paragraph.source: Chew it well, he thought, and get all the juices.
paragraph.target: よく噛んで、全てのジュースを取り出せ。

paragraph.source: It would not be bad to eat with a little lime or with lemon or with salt.
paragraph.target: 少しライムやレモン、塩と一緒に食べても悪くないだろう。

paragraph.source: “How do you feel, hand?” he asked the cramped hand that was almost as stiff as rigor mortis.
paragraph.target: 「手、どうだい？」と、彼はほぼ硬直症のように凝り固まった手に尋ねた。

paragraph.source: “I'll eat some more for you.”
paragraph.target: 「もう少し食べるよ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: He ate the other part of the piece that he had cut in two.
paragraph.target: 彼は2つに切ったもう片方の部分を食べた。

paragraph.source: He chewed it carefully and then spat out the skin.
paragraph.target: 彼は注意深く噛んでから、皮を吐き出した。

paragraph.source: “How does it go, hand? Or is it too early to know?”
paragraph.target: 「調子はどうだ、手？ それともまだ早すぎるか？」

paragraph.source: He took another full piece and chewed it.
paragraph.target: 彼はもう1つの大きな切れを取り、噛み砕いた。

paragraph.source: “It is a strong full-blooded fish,” he thought.
paragraph.target: 「これは力強い満ち趣味ある魚だ」と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: “I was lucky to get him instead of dolphin.
paragraph.target: 「イルカではなく、彼を手に入れたのは幸運だった。

paragraph.source: Dolphin is too sweet.
paragraph.target: イルカはあまりにも甘い。

paragraph.source: This is hardly sweet at all and all the strength is still in it.”
paragraph.target: これはほとんど甘くなく、全ての力がまだ残っている」と。

paragraph.source: There is no sense in being anything but practical though, he thought.
paragraph.target: しかし、実用的でないことは何もないと思った。

paragraph.source: I wish I had some salt.
paragraph.target: 塩があればいいのに。

paragraph.source: And I do not know whether the sun will rot or dry what is left, so I had better eat it all although I am not hungry.
paragraph.target: 残り物が太陽によって腐るのか乾燥するのかわからないので、空腹ではないが全部食べておくべきだ。

paragraph.source: The fish is calm and steady.
paragraph.target: 魚は穏やかで安定している。

paragraph.source: I will eat it all and then I will be ready.
paragraph.target: 全部食べて、それから準備が整うだろう。

paragraph.source: “Be patient, hand,” he said. “I do this for you.”
paragraph.target: 「辛抱していてくれ、手よ」と彼は言った。「君のためにやっているんだ」。

paragraph.source: I wish I could feed the fish, he thought.
paragraph.target: 魚に餌をやりたいな、彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: He is my brother.
paragraph.target: 彼は僕の兄弟だ。

paragraph.source: But I must kill him and keep strong to do it.
paragraph.target: でも、彼を殺さなきゃいけない。そしてそれをやり遂げるために強くならなきゃ。

paragraph.source: Slowly and conscientiously he ate all of the wedge-shaped strips of fish.
paragraph.target: 彼はゆっくりと、慎重に、魚のくさび形の切れ端を全部食べた。

paragraph.source: He straightened up, wiping his hand on his trousers.
paragraph.target: 彼は立ち上がり、手をズボンで拭いた。

paragraph.source: “Now,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「さあ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “You can let the cord go, hand, and I will handle him with the right arm alone until you stop that nonsense.”
paragraph.target: 「手、糸を放して、その馬鹿なことをやめるまで、右腕だけで彼を扱うよ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: He put his left foot on the heavy line that the left hand had held and lay back against the pull against his back.
paragraph.target: 彼は左手が持っていた重い糸に左足を乗せ、背中に引かれるのに対して後ろに倒れた。

paragraph.source: “God help me to have the cramp go,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「神よ、けいれんが治まりますように」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “Because I do not know what the fish is going to do.”
paragraph.target: 「魚が何をするかわかりませんから」と彼は続けた。

paragraph.source: But he seems calm, he thought, and following his plan.
paragraph.target: しかし、彼は落ち着いているようだと思った。そして、自分の計画に従っている。

paragraph.source: But what is his plan, he thought.
paragraph.target: しかし、彼の計画は何だろう、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: And what is mine?
paragraph.target: そして、私の計画は何だろうか？

paragraph.source: Mine I must improvise to his because of his great size.
paragraph.target: 私の計画は、彼の巨大さのために彼に合わせて即興で考えねばならない。

paragraph.source: If he will jump I can kill him.
paragraph.target: もし彼が飛び上がれば、私は彼を殺すことができる。

paragraph.source: But he stays down forever.
paragraph.target: しかし、彼は永遠に潜んだままだ。

paragraph.source: Then I will stay down with him forever.
paragraph.target: それなら、私も永遠に彼と一緒に潜んでいよう。

paragraph.source: He rubbed the cramped hand against his trousers and tried to gentle the fingers.
paragraph.target: 老人は痙攣した手をズボンにこすり、指を優しく動かそうとした。

paragraph.source: But it would not open.
paragraph.target: しかし、指は開かなかった。

paragraph.source: Maybe it will open with the sun, he thought.
paragraph.target: もしかしたら、太陽とともに指が開くだろう、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: Maybe it will open when the strong raw tuna is digested.
paragraph.target: もしかしたら、その強靭なマグロが消化されると指が開くだろう。

paragraph.source: If I have to have it, I will open it, cost whatever it costs.
paragraph.target: それを開かなければならないなら、どんな犠牲を払ってでも開くだろう。

paragraph.source: But I do not want to open it now by force.
paragraph.target: しかし、今は無理やり開けたくはない。

paragraph.source: Let it open by itself and come back of its own accord.
paragraph.target: 自然に開いて、自ら戻ってくるのを待とう。

paragraph.source: After all I abused it much in the night when it was necessary to free and unite the various lines.
paragraph.target: 結局のところ、様々な糸を解放し結合する必要があった夜、私はその手をかなり酷使した。

paragraph.source: He looked across the sea and knew how alone he was now.
paragraph.target: 彼は海を見渡し、今自分がどれほど孤独であるかを知っていた。

paragraph.source: But he could see the prisms in the deep dark water and the line stretching ahead and the strange undulation of the calm.
paragraph.target: しかし、彼は深く暗い水中のプリズムや前方に伸びるライン、穏やかな海の奇妙な揺らぎを見ることができた。

paragraph.source: The clouds were building up now for the trade wind and he looked ahead and saw a flight of wild ducks etching themselves against the sky over the water, then blurring, then etching again.
paragraph.target: 取引風のために雲が立ち込めており、彼は前を見据え、水上の空に向かって自分自身を浮かび上がらせる野生のアヒルの群れを見た。それがぼやけ、また浮かび上がるのを見た。

paragraph.source: And he knew no man was ever alone on the sea.
paragraph.target: そして彼は、誰もが海上で孤独ではないことを知っていた。

paragraph.source: He thought of how some men feared being out of sight of land in a small boat and knew they were right in the months of sudden bad weather.
paragraph.target: 彼は、小さな船で陸地が見えなくなることを恐れる人々のことを考え、突然の悪天候の月には彼らが正しかったと知っていた。

paragraph.source: But now they were in hurricane months and, when there are no hurricanes, the weather of hurricane months is the best of all the year.
paragraph.target: しかし、今はハリケーンの月に入っており、ハリケーンがないときは、ハリケーンの月の天候が一年中で最も良い。

paragraph.source: If there is a hurricane you always see the signs of it in the sky for days ahead, if you are at sea.
paragraph.target: もしハリケーンが来ると、海にいる場合は数日前から空にその兆候が見える。

paragraph.source: They do not see it ashore because they do not know what to look for, he thought.
paragraph.target: 陸からは見えない。何を探せばいいのか分からないからだ、彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: The land must make a difference too, in the shape of the clouds.
paragraph.target: 陸地も雲の形に違いをもたらすに違いない。

paragraph.source: But we have no hurricane coming now.
paragraph.target: しかし、今はハリケーンは来ていない。

paragraph.source: He looked at the sky and saw the white cumulus built like friendly piles of ice cream and high above were the thin feathers of the cirrus against the high September sky.
paragraph.target: 彼は空を見上げ、友好的なアイスクリームのように積み重ねられた白い積乱雲を見て、その高い上空には9月の高い空に対して薄い羽毛状の巻雲があった。

paragraph.source: “Light brisa,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「軽いそよ風だ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “Better weather for me than for you, fish.”
paragraph.target: 「僕にとっては君よりもいい天気だな、魚よ」と。

paragraph.source: His left hand was still cramped, but he was unknotting it slowly.
paragraph.target: 彼の左手はまだ痙攣していたが、彼はゆっくりとほぐしていた。

paragraph.source: I hate a cramp, he thought.
paragraph.target: けいれんは嫌だ、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: It is a treachery of one's own body.
paragraph.target: それは自分の体の裏切りだ。

paragraph.source: It is humiliating before others to have a diarrhoea from ptomaine poisoning or to vomit from it.
paragraph.target: 自分が腸チフスで下痢をするか、それから吐くことは、他人の前で恥ずかしい。

paragraph.source: But a cramp, he thought of it as a calambre, humiliates oneself especially when one is alone.
paragraph.target: しかし、けいれん、彼はそれをカランブレと考えた、それは特に一人の時に自分を恥辱する。

paragraph.source: If the boy were here he could rub it for me and loosen it down from the forearm, he thought.
paragraph.target: もし少年がここにいれば、彼がそれを揉んで腕から緩めてくれるだろうと彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: But it will loosen up.
paragraph.target: しかし、それは緩んでくるだろう。

paragraph.source: Then, with his right hand he felt the difference in the pull of the line before he saw the slant change in the water.
paragraph.target: そして、右手で糸の引っ張り具合の違いを感じ取り、水面の傾きの変化を見る前に。

paragraph.source: Then, as he leaned against the line and slapped his left hand hard and fast against his thigh he saw the line slanting slowly upward.
paragraph.target: そして、糸に寄りかかり、左手を太ももに強く速く叩くと、ゆっくりと上に傾く糸を見た。

paragraph.source: “He's coming up,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「上がってくるぞ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “Come on hand. Please come on.”
paragraph.target: 「さあ、手。お願いだから上がってくれ」と。

paragraph.source: The line rose slowly and steadily and then the surface of the ocean bulged ahead of the boat and the fish came out.
paragraph.target: 糸はゆっくりと着実に上昇し、その後、船の前方で海の表面が膨らみ、魚が現れた。

paragraph.source: He came out unendingly and water poured from his sides.
paragraph.target: 彼は絶え間なく現れ、水が側面から流れ出た。

paragraph.source: He was bright in the sun and his head and back were dark purple and in the sun the stripes on his sides showed wide and a light lavender.
paragraph.target: 彼は太陽の光に照らされて輝いており、頭と背中は濃い紫色で、太陽の光の中で側面のストライプが広く、淡いラベンダー色に見えた。

paragraph.source: His sword was as long as a baseball bat and tapered like a rapier and he rose his full length from the water and then re-entered it, smoothly, like a diver and the old man saw the great scythe-blade of his tail go under and the line commenced to race out.
paragraph.target: 彼の剣は野球のバットほどの長さで、レイピアのように細く尖っており、彼は全長を水から上げ、そして滑らかに、潜水士のように再び水中に入り、老人は彼の尾の大きな鎌刃が水中に潜るのを見て、糸が急速に走り出すのを目撃した。

paragraph.source: “He is two feet longer than the skiff,” the old man said.
paragraph.target: 「彼はスキフよりも2フィート長い」と老人は言った。

paragraph.source: The line was going out fast but steadily and the fish was not panicked.
paragraph.target: 糸は速くだが着実に出ていき、魚はパニックになっていなかった。

paragraph.source: The old man was trying with both hands to keep the line just inside of breaking strength.
paragraph.target: 老人は両手で糸を破断点の内側に保つように努力していた。

paragraph.source: He knew that if he could not slow the fish with a steady pressure the fish could take out all the line and break it.
paragraph.target: 彼は、一定の圧力で魚を遅らせることができなければ、魚が全ての糸を引き出して切ってしまうことを知っていた。

paragraph.source: He is a great fish and I must convince him, he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼は立派な魚だ。私は彼を納得させなければならないと思った。

paragraph.source: I must never let him learn his strength nor what he could do if he made his run.
paragraph.target: 彼に自分の力や、突進した場合に何ができるかを学ばせてはならない。

paragraph.source: If I were him I would put in everything now and go until something broke.
paragraph.target: もし私が彼なら、今全力を尽くし、何かが壊れるまで進むだろう。

paragraph.source: But, thank God, they are not as intelligent as we who kill them; although they are more noble and more able.
paragraph.target: しかし、感謝すべきことに、私たちが彼らを殺すよりも彼らは賢くない。しかし、彼らはより高貴で、より能力がある。

paragraph.source: The old man had seen many great fish.
paragraph.target: 老人は多くの大物を見てきた。

paragraph.source: He had seen many that weighed more than a thousand pounds and he had caught two of that size in his life, but never alone.
paragraph.target: 千ポンド以上の重さの魚を何匹も見てきたし、その大きさのものを2匹は釣ったことがあるが、一人で釣ったことはない。

paragraph.source: Now alone, and out of sight of land, he was fast to the biggest fish that he had ever seen and bigger than he had ever heard of, and his left hand was still as tight as the gripped claws of an eagle.
paragraph.target: 今は一人で、陸地が見えないところにいて、今まで見たことのある中で最も大きな魚に繋がれていた。それは聞いたこともないほど大きく、左手はまだ鷲の鉤爪のように固く握りしめられていた。

paragraph.source: It will uncramp though, he thought.
paragraph.target: しかし、それはほぐれるだろう、彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: Surely it will uncramp to help my right hand.
paragraph.target: きっと、それは右手を助けるためにほぐれるだろう。

paragraph.source: There are three things that are brothers: the fish and my two hands.
paragraph.target: 三つのものが兄弟である：魚と私の両手。

paragraph.source: It must uncramp. It is unworthy of it to be cramped.
paragraph.target: それはほぐれなければならない。それが締まることはそれにふさわしくない。

paragraph.source: The fish had slowed again and was going at his usual pace.
paragraph.target: 魚は再び遅くなり、いつもの速さで進んでいた。

paragraph.source: I wonder why he jumped, the old man thought.
paragraph.target: 老人はなぜ彼が飛び跳ねたのかと考えた。

paragraph.source: He jumped almost as though to show me how big he was.
paragraph.target: 彼は自分がどれほど大きいかを示すかのようにほとんど飛び跳ねた。

paragraph.source: I know now, anyway, he thought.
paragraph.target: とにかく今はわかっている、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: I wish I could show him what sort of man I am.
paragraph.target: 彼に自分がどんな人間かを示せたらいいのにと思った。

paragraph.source: But then he would see the cramped hand.
paragraph.target: しかし、そのとき彼は手がけいれんしているのを見てしまうだろう。

paragraph.source: Let him think I am more man than I am and I will be so.
paragraph.target: 彼に自分が実際よりも男らしいと思わせてやろう。そうすれば、そうなるだろう。

paragraph.source: I wish I was the fish, he thought, with everything he has against only my will and my intelligence.
paragraph.target: 魚であれたらいいのに、彼が持っているものすべてが、ただ自分の意志と知性に対抗している。

paragraph.source: He settled comfortably against the wood and took his suffering as it came and the fish swam steadily and the boat moved slowly through the dark water.
paragraph.target: 彼は木に快適に寄りかかり、苦しみを受け入れ、魚は着実に泳ぎ、船は暗い水をゆっくり進んでいった。

paragraph.source: There was a small sea rising with the wind coming up from the east and at noon the old man's left hand was uncramped.
paragraph.target: 東から吹く風とともに小さな波が立ち、昼には老人の左手がほぐれた。

paragraph.source: “Bad news for you, fish,” he said and shifted the line over the sacks that covered his shoulders.
paragraph.target: 「お前にとっては悪い知らせだな、魚」と彼は言い、肩にかけた袋の上に糸を移動させた。

paragraph.source: He was comfortable but suffering, although he did not admit the suffering at all.
paragraph.target: 彼は快適だったが苦しんでいた。しかし、彼は全く苦しみを認めなかった。

paragraph.source: “I am not religious,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「私は宗教的ではありません」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “But I will say ten Our Fathers and ten Hail Marys that I should catch this fish, and I promise to make a pilgrimage to the Virgen de Cobre if I catch him.
paragraph.target: しかし、この魚を捕まえるために十回『天の父』と十回『聖母マリア』を唱えることを約束し、もし捕まえたらビルヘン・デ・コブレの巡礼をすることを誓います。

paragraph.source: That is a promise.”
paragraph.target: それは約束です」。

paragraph.source: He commenced to say his prayers mechanically.
paragraph.target: 彼は機械的に祈りを始めた。

paragraph.source: Sometimes he would be so tired that he could not remember the prayer and then he would say them fast so that they would come automatically.
paragraph.target: 時々、彼は疲れて祈りを覚えていられないことがあり、そのときは早口で言って自動的に出てくるようにした。

paragraph.source: Hail Marys are easier to say than Our Fathers, he thought.
paragraph.target: ハイル・メアリーはアヴェ・マリアよりも言いやすい、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: “Hail Mary full of Grace the Lord is with thee. Blessed art thou among women and blessed is the fruit of thy womb, Jesus. Holy Mary, Mother of God, pray for us sinners now and at the hour of our death. Amen.”
paragraph.target: 「恵みに満ちたマリアよ、主はあなたと共におられます。あなたは女たちの中で祝福され、あなたの胎内のイエスも祝福されています。聖母マリア、神の母よ、私たち罪人のために今、そして私たちの死の時に祈ってください。アーメン。」

paragraph.source: Then he added, “Blessed Virgin, pray for the death of this fish. Wonderful though he is.”
paragraph.target: そして彼は付け加えた。「祝福された聖母、この魚の死を祈ってください。たとえ彼が素晴らしい存在であっても。」

paragraph.source: With his prayers said, and feeling much better, but suffering exactly as much, and perhaps a little more, he leaned against the wood of the bow and began, mechanically, to work the fingers of his left hand.
paragraph.target: 祈りを捧げた老人は、気持ちがよくなったが、同じだけ苦しんでおり、おそらく少し多く苦しんでいる。彼は船首の木に寄りかかり、左手の指を機械的に動かし始めた。

paragraph.source: The sun was hot now although the breeze was rising gently.
paragraph.target: 太陽は今や熱かったが、そよ風は穏やかに立ち上がっていた。

paragraph.source: “I had better re-bait that little line out over the stern,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「良いだろう、船尾の方にある小さな釣り針を再度餌付けしよう」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “If the fish decides to stay another night I will need to eat again and the water is low in the bottle.
paragraph.target: 「もし魚がもう一晩ここにとどまることを決めたら、再び食事をしなければならないし、水筒の水も少ない。

paragraph.source: I don't think I can get anything but a dolphin here.
paragraph.target: ここではイルカ以外は何も釣れないだろう。

paragraph.source: But if I eat him fresh enough he won't be bad.
paragraph.target: でも、新鮮な状態で食べればまずくはないだろう。

paragraph.source: I wish a flying fish would come on board tonight.
paragraph.target: 今夜はトビウオが船に乗ってくれたらいいのに。

paragraph.source: But I have no light to attract them.
paragraph.target: でも、彼らを引き寄せるための光はない。

paragraph.source: A flying fish is excellent to eat raw and I would not have to cut him up.
paragraph.target: トビウオは生で食べるのに最適で、解体する必要もない。

paragraph.source: I must save all my strength now.
paragraph.target: 今は全力を保存しなければならない。

paragraph.source: Christ, I did not know he was so big.”
paragraph.target: クライスト、彼がこんなに大きいとは知らなかった。」

paragraph.source: “I'll kill him though,” he said. “In all his greatness and his glory.”
paragraph.target: 「それでも殺すぞ」と彼は言った。「彼の偉大さと栄光の中で。」

paragraph.source: Although it is unjust, he thought.
paragraph.target: 不公平だと思った。

paragraph.source: But I will show him what a man can do and what a man endures.
paragraph.target: しかし、私は彼に男が何を成し遂げ、何を耐え忍ぶことができるかを示すだろう。

paragraph.source: “I told the boy I was a strange old man,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「僕は変わった老人だと少年に言った」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “Now is when I must prove it.”
paragraph.target: 「今こそそれを証明しなければならない時だ」と。

paragraph.source: The thousand times that he had proved it meant nothing.
paragraph.target: 彼がそれを証明した千回は何の意味もなかった。

paragraph.source: Now he was proving it again.
paragraph.target: 今、彼は再びそれを証明していた。

paragraph.source: Each time was a new time and he never thought about the past when he was doing it.
paragraph.target: それぞれの瞬間は新しい瞬間であり、彼はそれを行う際に過去を考えたことはなかった。

paragraph.source: I wish he'd sleep and I could sleep and dream about the lions, he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼が眠ってくれたら、私も眠ってライオンの夢を見られるのにな、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Why are the lions the main thing that is left?
paragraph.target: なぜライオンが最後に残っているのだろう？

paragraph.source: Don't think, old man, he said to himself.
paragraph.target: 考えるな、老人よ、と彼は自分に言った。

paragraph.source: Rest gently now against the wood and think of nothing.
paragraph.target: 今は木に優しく寄りかかって何も考えるな。

paragraph.source: He is working.
paragraph.target: 彼は働いている。

paragraph.source: Work as little as you can.
paragraph.target: できるだけ少なく働け。

paragraph.source: It was getting into the afternoon and the boat still moved slowly and steadily.
paragraph.target: 午後に差し掛かり、船はまだゆっくりと着実に進んでいた。

paragraph.source: But there was an added drag now from the easterly breeze and the old man rode gently with the small sea and the hurt of the cord across his back came to him easily and smoothly.
paragraph.target: しかし、今や東風からの追い風が加わり、老人は小さな海と共に優しく進んでいた。背中に痛みを感じながらも、コードの痛みは彼に容易に滑らかに伝わってきた。

paragraph.source: Once in the afternoon the line started to rise again.
paragraph.target: 午後になると、糸が再び上がり始めた。

paragraph.source: But the fish only continued to swim at a slightly higher level.
paragraph.target: しかし、魚はわずかに高い水準で泳ぎ続けた。

paragraph.source: The sun was on the old man's left arm and shoulder and on his back.
paragraph.target: 太陽は老人の左腕や肩、背中に当たっていた。

paragraph.source: So he knew the fish had turned east of north.
paragraph.target: だから彼は、魚が北より東に向きを変えたことを知っていた。

paragraph.source: Now that he had seen him once, he could picture the fish swimming in the water with his purple pectoral fins set wide as wings and the great erect tail slicing through the dark.
paragraph.target: 彼が一度見たことがあるので、老人は魚が水中を泳ぐ様子を想像することができました。紫色の胸びれが翼のように広がり、立派な尾びれが暗闇を切り裂いている姿を。

paragraph.source: I wonder how much he sees at that depth, the old man thought.
paragraph.target: 老人は考えました。「あの深さで彼はどれくらい見えるのだろう」

paragraph.source: His eye is huge and a horse, with much less eye, can see in the dark.
paragraph.target: 彼の目は巨大で、馬でさえ目が少ないのに暗闇で見ることができる。

paragraph.source: Once I could see quite well in the dark.
paragraph.target: かつては暗闇でもかなりよく見えたものだ。

paragraph.source: Not in the absolute dark.
paragraph.target: 真っ暗闇ではないが。

paragraph.source: But almost as a cat sees.
paragraph.target: でも、まるで猫が見るようにほとんど見えた。

paragraph.source: The sun and his steady movement of his fingers had uncramped his left hand now completely.
paragraph.target: 太陽と指の着実な動きにより、彼の左手は完全に緩んでいた。

paragraph.source: He began to shift more of the strain to it and he shrugged the muscles of his back to shift the hurt of the cord a little.
paragraph.target: 彼はその負担の一部を左手に移し始め、背中の筋肉をすくめてコードの痛みを少し和らげた。

paragraph.source: “If you're not tired, fish,” he said aloud, “you must be very strange.”
paragraph.target: 「疲れていないなら、魚よ」と彼は声に出して言った。「君はとても奇妙な存在だろう」。」

paragraph.source: He felt very tired now and he knew the night would come soon and he tried to think of other things.
paragraph.target: 彼は今とても疲れていて、夜がすぐに訪れることを知って、他のことを考えようとしました。

paragraph.source: He thought of the Big Leagues, to him they were the Gran Ligas, and he knew that the Yankees of New York were playing the Tigres of Detroit.
paragraph.target: 彼はビッグリーグを思い浮かべました、彼にとってそれはグランリーガスであり、ニューヨーク・ヤンキースがデトロイト・タイガースと試合をしていることを知っていました。

paragraph.source: This is the second day now that I do not know the result of the juegos, he thought.
paragraph.target: これで2日目だ。まだ試合の結果を知らない。

paragraph.source: But I must have confidence and I must be worthy of the great DiMaggio who does all things perfectly even with the pain of the bone spur in his heel.
paragraph.target: しかし、自信を持たねばならぬ。そして、偉大なディマジオに値する者でありたい。彼はかかとの骨棘の痛みにも完璧にすべてをこなす。

paragraph.source: What is a bone spur? he asked himself.
paragraph.target: 骨棘とは何だろう？

paragraph.source: Un espuela de hueso. We do not have them.
paragraph.target: 骨の棘。我々にはない。

paragraph.source: Can it be as painful as the spur of a fighting cock in one's heel?
paragraph.target: それは、闘鶏のかかとにある棘ほど痛いものだろうか？

paragraph.source: I do not think I could endure that or the loss of the eye and of both eyes and continue to fight as the fighting cocks do.
paragraph.target: 私にはそれを耐えられる自信がない。また、目を1つ、あるいは両方失って、闘鶏のように戦い続けることもできないだろう。

paragraph.source: Man is not much beside the great birds and beasts.
paragraph.target: 人間は、偉大な鳥や獣に比べると大したことはない。

paragraph.source: Still I would rather be that beast down there in the darkness of the sea.
paragraph.target: それでも、私は海の暗闇の中にいるあの獣でありたい。

paragraph.source: “Unless sharks come,” he said aloud. “If sharks come, God pity him and me.”
paragraph.target: 「サメが来ない限り」と彼は声に出して言った。「もしサメが来たら、神よ、彼と私を哀れんでくれ」。」

paragraph.source: Do you believe the great DiMaggio would stay with a fish as long as I will stay with this one?
paragraph.target: 偉大なディマジオは、私がこの魚と一緒にいる時間だけ長く魚ととどまると思いますか？

paragraph.source: he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: I am sure he would and more since he is young and strong.
paragraph.target: 彼は若く強いので、きっと私以上に長く魚ととどまるでしょう。

paragraph.source: Also his father was a fisherman.
paragraph.target: 彼の父も漁師だった。

paragraph.source: But would the bone spur hurt him too much?
paragraph.target: しかし、骨棘は彼にあまりにも痛みをもたらすでしょうか？

paragraph.source: “I do not know,” he said aloud.
paragraph.target: 「わからないな」と彼は声に出して言った。

paragraph.source: “I never had a bone spur.”
paragraph.target: 「骨棘は過去になかった」と彼は続けた。

paragraph.source: As the sun set he remembered, to give himself more confidence, the time in the tavern at Casablanca when he had played the hand game with the great negro from Cienfuegos who was the strongest man on the docks.
paragraph.target: 太陽が沈むと、彼は自信をつけるために、カサブランカの酒場で、ドックで最も強い男であるシエンフエゴス出身の大黒人と手のゲームをしたときを思い出した。

paragraph.source: They had gone one day and one night with their elbows on a chalk line on the table and their forearms straight up and their hands gripped tight.
paragraph.target: 彼らはテーブルのチョークの線に肘をついて、前腕をまっすぐにし、手をしっかり握りしめて、1日1晩過ごした。

paragraph.source: Each one was trying to force the other's hand down onto the table.
paragraph.target: お互いが相手の手をテーブルに押し付けようとしていた。

paragraph.source: There was much betting and people went in and out of the room under the kerosene lights and he had looked at the arm and hand of the negro and at the negro's face.
paragraph.target: 多くの賭けがあり、人々が石油ランプの下で部屋に出入りしていた。彼は黒人の腕や手、顔を見つめた。

paragraph.source: They changed the referees every four hours after the first eight so that the referees could sleep.
paragraph.target: 最初の8時間後に4時間ごとに審判を交代させ、審判が眠れるようにしていた。

paragraph.source: Blood came out from under the fingernails of both his and the negro's hands and they looked each other in the eye and at their hands and forearms and the bettors went in and out of the room and sat on high chairs against the wall and watched.
paragraph.target: 爪の下から血が出ており、お互いの目を見つめ合い、手や前腕を見つめ、賭け人が部屋に出入りして壁に高い椅子に座って見ていた。

paragraph.source: The walls were painted bright blue and were of wood and the lamps threw their shadows against them.
paragraph.target: 壁は明るい青で塗られ、木製で、ランプがその影を投げかけていた。

paragraph.source: The negro's shadow was huge and it moved on the wall as the breeze moved the lamps.
paragraph.target: 黒人の影は巨大で、風がランプを動かすように壁を移動していた。

paragraph.source: The odds would change back and forth all night and they fed the negro rum and lighted cigarettes for him.
paragraph.target: オッズは一晩中何度も変わり、彼らは黒人にラム酒を飲ませ、たばこを吸わせた。

paragraph.source: Then the negro, after the rum, would try for a tremendous effort and once he had the old man, who was not an old man then but was Santiago El Campeon, nearly three inches off balance.
paragraph.target: その後、黒人はラム酒を飲んだ後、凄まじい努力を試み、かつては老人ではなくサンチャゴ・エル・カンペオンだった老人を、ほぼ3インチもバランスを崩させたことがあった。

paragraph.source: But the old man had raised his hand up to dead even again.
paragraph.target: しかし、老人は再び手を完全に持ち直した。

paragraph.source: He was sure then that he had the negro, who was a fine man and a great athlete, beaten.
paragraph.target: その時、彼は自信を持って、立派な男であり偉大なアスリートである黒人を打ち負かしたと確信していた。

paragraph.source: And at daylight when the bettors were asking that it be called a draw and the referee was shaking his head, he had unleashed his effort and forced the hand of the negro down and down until it rested on the wood.
paragraph.target: そして、明け方には賭け手たちが引き分けと言い出し、審判が首を振っている時、彼は努力を解き放ち、黒人の手を下に押し下げ、最終的には木に置かせた。

paragraph.source: The match had started on a Sunday morning and ended on a Monday morning.
paragraph.target: 試合は日曜日の朝に始まり、月曜日の朝に終わった。

paragraph.source: Many of the bettors had asked for a draw because they had to go to work on the docks loading sacks of sugar or at the Havana Coal Company.
paragraph.target: 多くの賭け手が引き分けを求めたのは、砂糖袋を積むためにドックで働かなければならないか、ハバナ石炭会社で働かなければならないからだ。

paragraph.source: Otherwise everyone would have wanted it to go to a finish.
paragraph.target: さもなければ、誰もが最後まで行かせたがっていたであろう。

paragraph.source: But he had finished it anyway and before anyone had to go to work.
paragraph.target: しかし、彼はそれを終わらせ、誰もが仕事に行かなければならない前に。

paragraph.source: For a long time after that everyone had called him The Champion and there had been a return match in the spring.
paragraph.target: その後長い間、誰もが彼を“チャンピオン”と呼び、春にはリターンマッチが行われた。

paragraph.source: But not much money was bet and he had won it quite easily since he had broken the confidence of the negro from Cienfuegos in the first match.
paragraph.target: しかし、賭け金はそれほど多くなく、最初の試合でシエンフエゴス出身の黒人の自信を打ち砕いたため、彼はかなり簡単に勝利した。

paragraph.source: After that he had a few matches and then no more.
paragraph.target: その後、いくつかの試合を行ったが、それ以上はなかった。

paragraph.source: He decided that he could beat anyone if he wanted to badly enough and he decided that it was bad for his right hand for fishing.
paragraph.target: 彼は、自分が本気で望めば誰にでも勝てると決め、また、右手を釣りに使うのは良くないと決めた。

paragraph.source: He had tried a few practice matches with his left hand.
paragraph.target: 彼は左手でいくつかの練習試合を試みた。

paragraph.source: But his left hand had always been a traitor and would not do what he called on it to do and he did not trust it.
paragraph.target: しかし、彼の左手は常に裏切り者であり、彼が求めることをしてくれず、彼はそれを信用していなかった。

paragraph.source: The sun will bake it out well now, he thought.
paragraph.target: 今は太陽がよく乾かしてくれるだろう、彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: It should not cramp on me again unless it gets too cold in the night.
paragraph.target: 夜になって寒くならない限り、再び筋肉が攣ることはないはずだ。

paragraph.source: I wonder what this night will bring.
paragraph.target: この夜は何をもたらすのだろう。

paragraph.source: An airplane passed over head on its course to Miami and he watched its shadow scaring up the schools of flying fish.
paragraph.target: マイアミ行きの飛行機が頭上を通過し、老人はその影を見て、飛び立つ群れの飛び魚を驚かせた。

paragraph.source: “With so much flying fish there should be dolphin,” he said, and leaned back on the line to see if it was possible to gain any on his fish.
paragraph.target: 「こんなにたくさんのトビウオがいるなら、イルカもいるはずだ」と彼は言い、魚に何かつけることができるかどうかを確かめるために糸にもたれかかった。

paragraph.source: But he could not and it stayed at the hardness and water-drop shivering that preceded breaking.
paragraph.target: しかし、彼はそれをつけることができず、それは破れる前の硬さと水滴が震える状態のままだった。

paragraph.source: The boat moved ahead slowly and he watched the airplane until he could no longer see it.
paragraph.target: ボートはゆっくりと前進し、彼は飛行機を見つめ続けたが、もう見えなくなるまで。

paragraph.source: It must be very strange in an airplane, he thought.
paragraph.target: 飛行機の中はとても奇妙だろうな、彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: I wonder what the sea looks like from that height?
paragraph.target: その高さから見た海はどんな風に見えるのだろうか？

paragraph.source: They should be able to see the fish well if they do not fly too high.
paragraph.target: 高すぎなければ、彼らは魚をよく見ることができるはずだ。

paragraph.source: I would like to fly very slowly at two hundred fathoms high and see the fish from above.
paragraph.target: 200ファゾムの高さでゆっくり飛んで、魚を上から見てみたいと思う。

paragraph.source: In the turtle boats I was in the cross-trees of the mast-head and even at that height I saw much.
paragraph.target: 亀の船では、マストのクロスツリーにいて、その高さでもたくさんのものを見た。

paragraph.source: The dolphin look greener from there and you can see their stripes and their purple spots and you can see all of the school as they swim.
paragraph.target: イルカはそこから見るとより緑色に見え、ストライプや紫の斑点が見え、泳ぐ群れ全体を見ることができる。

paragraph.source: Why is it that all the fast-moving fish of the dark current have purple backs and usually purple stripes or spots?
paragraph.target: なぜ暗い流れの速い魚たちは背中が紫色で、通常は紫色のストライプや斑点があるのだろうか？

paragraph.source: The dolphin looks green of course because he is really golden.
paragraph.target: イルカはもちろん緑色に見えるのは、実際には金色だからだ。

paragraph.source: But when he comes to feed, truly hungry, purple stripes show on his sides as on a marlin.
paragraph.target: しかし、本当に空腹で餌を取ると、イルカの側面にはマーリンのように紫のストライプが現れる。

paragraph.source: Can it be anger, or the greater speed he makes that brings them out?
paragraph.target: それは怒りなのか、それとも彼がより速く泳ぐことが原因なのか？

paragraph.source: Just before it was dark, as they passed a great island of Sargasso weed that heaved and swung in the light sea as though the ocean were making love with something under a yellow blanket, his small line was taken by a dolphin.
paragraph.target: 夕暮れどき、彼らが大きなサルガッソー草の島を通り過ぎるとき、海が光の中で揺れ動き、まるで海が黄色い毛布の下で何かと愛を交わしているかのようであった。そのとき、彼の小さな釣り糸はイルカに引かれた。

paragraph.source: He saw it first when it jumped in the air, true gold in the last of the sun and bending and flapping wildly in the air.
paragraph.target: 彼は、それが空中で跳ねるときに初めて見た。太陽の最後の光の中で真の金色であり、空中で釣り曲げられ、乱れ飛び回っていた。

paragraph.source: It jumped again and again in the acrobatics of its fear and he worked his way back to the stern and crouching and holding the big line with his right hand and arm, he pulled the dolphin in with his left hand, stepping on the gained line each time with his bare left foot.
paragraph.target: それは恐怖の曲芸で何度も跳ね、彼は船尾に戻り、しゃがんで右手と腕で大きな釣り糸を持ち、左手でイルカを引き寄せ、裸足の左足で毎回獲得した糸に踏み込んだ。

paragraph.source: When the fish was at the stern, plunging and cutting from side to side in desperation, the old man leaned over the stern and lifted the burnished gold fish with its purple spots over the stern.
paragraph.target: 魚が船尾にいて、絶望的に横から横へと突進し、老人は船尾に身を乗り出し、紫の斑点がある磨かれた金色の魚を船尾の上に持ち上げた。

paragraph.source: Its jaws were working convulsively in quick bites against the hook and it pounded the bottom of the skiff with its long flat body, its tail and its head until he clubbed it across the shining golden head until it shivered and was still.
paragraph.target: その顎はフックに対して痙攣的に素早く噛みつき、長い平らな体、尾、頭でスキフの底を叩き、老人が輝く金色の頭を横切ってそれを殴るまで、震えて静止した。

paragraph.source: The old man unhooked the fish, rebaited the line with another sardine and tossed it over.
paragraph.target: 老人は魚を外し、別のサーディンで釣り糸を再度装着し、海に投げ込んだ。

paragraph.source: Then he worked his way slowly back to the bow.
paragraph.target: そして、彼はゆっくりと船首に向かって進んだ。

paragraph.source: He washed his left hand and wiped it on his trousers.
paragraph.target: 彼は左手を洗い、ズボンで拭いた。

paragraph.source: Then he shifted the heavy line from his right hand to his left and washed his right hand in the sea while he watched the sun go into the ocean and the slant of the big cord.
paragraph.target: そして、彼は右手から重い釣り糸を左手に移し、右手を海で洗いながら、太陽が海に沈み、大きな糸の傾斜を見つめた。

paragraph.source: “He hasn't changed at all,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「彼は全く変わっていない」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: But watching the movement of the water against his hand he noted that it was perceptibly slower.
paragraph.target: しかし、手に触れる水の動きを見ながら、それが明らかに遅くなっていることに気づいた。

paragraph.source: “I'll lash the two oars together across the stern and that will slow him in the night,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「船尾に二本のオールを縛りつけて、それで夜中に彼を遅らせる」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “He's good for the night and so am I.”
paragraph.target: 「彼は夜を乗り切れるし、私もだ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: It would be better to gut the dolphin a little later to save the blood in the meat, he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼は、肉の中の血を保存するためにイルカの内臓を少し後で取り除く方が良いだろうと考えた。

paragraph.source: I can do that a little later and lash the oars to make a drag at the same time.
paragraph.target: 後でそれを行い、同時にオールを縛って引きずりを作ることができる。

paragraph.source: I had better keep the fish quiet now and not disturb him too much at sunset.
paragraph.target: 今は魚を静かにしておいて、夕日の時にあまり彼を邪魔しない方が良いだろう。

paragraph.source: The setting of the sun is a difficult time for all fish.
paragraph.target: 夕日の沈む時間はすべての魚にとって難しい時間だ。

paragraph.source: He let his hand dry in the air then grasped the line with it and eased himself as much as he could and allowed himself to be pulled forward against the wood so that the boat took the strain as much, or more, than he did.
paragraph.target: 彼は手を空中で乾かし、それからその手で糸を掴んで、できるだけ身を楽にして、自分を前に引かれるようにして、船が彼よりも同じかそれ以上の負担を受けるようにした。

paragraph.source: I'm learning how to do it, he thought.
paragraph.target: これをやり方を学んでいるんだ、彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: This part of it anyway.
paragraph.target: とにかく、これの一部だ。

paragraph.source: Then too, remember he hasn't eaten since he took the bait and he is huge and needs much food.
paragraph.target: それに、彼は餌を食べてからずっと食事をしていないことを覚えておくべきだし、彼は巨大でたくさんの食べ物が必要だ。

paragraph.source: I have eaten the whole bonito.
paragraph.target: 私はそのカツオを丸ごと食べた。

paragraph.source: Tomorrow I will eat the dolphin.
paragraph.target: 明日はそのイルカを食べるだろう。

paragraph.source: He called it dorado.
paragraph.target: 彼はそれをドラドと呼んだ。

paragraph.source: Perhaps I should eat some of it when I clean it.
paragraph.target: 掃除をするときに少し食べるべきかもしれない。

paragraph.source: It will be harder to eat than the bonito.
paragraph.target: それはカツオよりも食べにくいだろう。

paragraph.source: But, then, nothing is easy.
paragraph.target: しかし、何事も簡単ではない。

paragraph.source: “How do you feel, fish?” he asked aloud.
paragraph.target: 「魚よ、気分はどうだ？」と彼は大声で尋ねた。

paragraph.source: “I feel good and my left hand is better and I have food for a night and a day. Pull the boat, fish.”
paragraph.target: 「元気だし、左手も良くなってきたし、夜と昼の食べ物もある。船を引け、魚よ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: He did not truly feel good because the pain from the cord across his back had almost passed pain and gone into a dullness that he mistrusted.
paragraph.target: 彼は本当に気分が良いとは感じていなかった。背中にかかる痛みはほとんど痛みを通り越して、信用できない鈍痛に変わっていた。

paragraph.source: But I have had worse things than that, he thought.
paragraph.target: でも、これよりもひどいことは経験してきた、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: My hand is only cut a little and the cramp is gone from the other.
paragraph.target: 手は少し切れているだけで、もう片方の手のけいれんもなくなった。

paragraph.source: My legs are all right.
paragraph.target: 足も大丈夫だ。

paragraph.source: Also now I have gained on him in the question of sustenance.
paragraph.target: そして今、私は彼に対して食糧の点で優位に立っている。

paragraph.source: It was dark now as it becomes dark quickly after the sun sets in September.
paragraph.target: 9月に太陽が沈んだ後はすぐに暗くなる。

paragraph.source: He lay against the worn wood of the bow and rested all that he could.
paragraph.target: 彼は船首の古びた木に寄りかかり、できる限り休んだ。

paragraph.source: The first stars were out.
paragraph.target: 最初の星が出ていた。

paragraph.source: He did not know the name of Rigel but he saw it and knew soon they would all be out and he would have all his distant friends.
paragraph.target: リゲルの名前は知らなかったが、それを見て、すぐにすべての星が出て、遠い友達がそろうことを知っていた。

paragraph.source: “The fish is my friend too,” he said aloud.
paragraph.target: 「その魚も僕の友達だ」と彼は声に出して言った。

paragraph.source: “I have never seen or heard of such a fish.
paragraph.target: こんな魚は見たことも聞いたこともない。

paragraph.source: But I must kill him.
paragraph.target: だが、彼を殺さなければならない。

paragraph.source: I am glad we do not have to try to kill the stars.”
paragraph.target: 僕たちは星を殺す必要はないと思う」

paragraph.source: Imagine if each day a man must try to kill the moon, he thought.
paragraph.target: もし毎日、人が月を殺さなければならないとしたら、彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: The moon runs away.
paragraph.target: 月は逃げる。

paragraph.source: But imagine if a man each day should have to try to kill the sun?
paragraph.target: でももし毎日、人が太陽を殺さなければならないとしたら？

paragraph.source: We were born lucky, he thought.
paragraph.target: 僕たちは幸運に生まれたんだ、彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: Then he was sorry for the great fish that had nothing to eat and his determination to kill him never relaxed in his sorrow for him.
paragraph.target: そして、彼は何も食べるものがない偉大な魚に気の毒に思い、彼を殺す決意は彼に対する悲しみの中で決して揺るがなかった。

paragraph.source: How many people will he feed, he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼はどれだけの人々に食料を提供するのだろう、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: But are they worthy to eat him? No, of course not.
paragraph.target: しかし、彼らは彼を食べるに値する人々なのだろうか？いいえ、もちろんそうではない。

paragraph.source: There is no one worthy of eating him from the manner of his behaviour and his great dignity.
paragraph.target: 彼の行動様式や彼の偉大な尊厳からして、彼を食べるに値する人はいない。

paragraph.source: I do not understand these things, he thought.
paragraph.target: これらのことは理解できないな、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: But it is good that we do not have to try to kill the sun or the moon or the stars.
paragraph.target: しかし、太陽や月や星を殺す必要はないのは良いことだ。

paragraph.source: It is enough to live on the sea and kill our true brothers.
paragraph.target: 海で生き、我々の本当の兄弟を殺すことで十分だ。

paragraph.source: Now, he thought, I must think about the drag.
paragraph.target: さて、彼は考えた、引きずりについて考えねばならぬ。

paragraph.source: It has its perils and its merits.
paragraph.target: それには危険も利点もある。

paragraph.source: I may lose so much line that I will lose him, if he makes his effort and the drag made by the oars is in place and the boat loses all her lightness.
paragraph.target: もし彼が力を尽くし、オールによる引きずりが効いてしまい、船が軽快さを失ってしまうと、私は多くの釣り糸を失い、彼を失ってしまうかもしれない。

paragraph.source: Her lightness prolongs both our suffering but it is my safety since he has great speed that he has never yet employed.
paragraph.target: 船の軽快さは私たちの苦しみを長引かせるが、彼はまだ使ったことのない大きな速さを持っているため、私の安全を確保している。

paragraph.source: No matter what passes I must gut the dolphin so he does not spoil and eat some of him to be strong.
paragraph.target: 何が起ころうと、イルカの内臓を取り除いて腐らせぬようにし、彼の一部を食べて力をつけねばならぬ。

paragraph.source: Now I will rest an hour more and feel that he is solid and steady before I move back to the stern to do the work and make the decision.
paragraph.target: 今、もう1時間休んで、彼がしっかりと安定していることを感じてから、船尾に戻って作業をし、決断を下す。

paragraph.source: In the meantime I can see how he acts and if he shows any changes.
paragraph.target: その間、彼の行動を見て、何か変化があるかどうかを確認できる。

paragraph.source: The oars are a good trick; but it has reached the time to play for safety.
paragraph.target: オールはいい手だが、安全を確保するための時が来た。

paragraph.source: He is much fish still and I saw that the hook was in the corner of his mouth and he has kept his mouth tight shut.
paragraph.target: 彼はまだたくさんの魚だが、私は針が口の隅に刺さっているのを見た。彼は口をきっちり閉じている。

paragraph.source: The punishment of the hook is nothing. The punishment of hunger, and that he is against something that he does not comprehend, is everything.
paragraph.target: 針の罰は何もない。しかし、空腹の罰、そして彼が理解できない何かに対して抗うことがすべてだ。

paragraph.source: Rest now, old man, and let him work until your next duty comes.
paragraph.target: 今は休んでいるが、老人よ、次の任務が来るまで彼に任せておけ。

paragraph.source: He rested for what he believed to be two hours.
paragraph.target: 彼は自分が2時間休んだと信じていた。

paragraph.source: The moon did not rise now until late and he had no way of judging the time.
paragraph.target: 月は今は遅くまで昇らず、時間を判断する手段がなかった。

paragraph.source: Nor was he really resting except comparatively.
paragraph.target: 彼は比較的にしか休んでいなかった。

paragraph.source: He was still bearing the pull of the fish across his shoulders but he placed his left hand on the gunwale of the bow and confided more and more of the resistance to the fish to the skiff itself.
paragraph.target: 彼はまだ魚の引っ張りを肩に感じていたが、左手を船首の舷に置き、ますます魚の抵抗をスキフ自体に任せるようにした。

paragraph.source: How simple it would be if I could make the line fast, he thought.
paragraph.target: 糸をしっかりと結ぶことができたら、どれほど簡単だろうと彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: But with one small lurch he could break it.
paragraph.target: しかし、小さな突然の動きで糸を切ってしまうかもしれない。

paragraph.source: I must cushion the pull of the line with my body and at all times be ready to give line with both hands.
paragraph.target: 糸の引っ張りを体で緩和し、常に両手で糸を出す準備をしていなければならない。

paragraph.source: “But you have not slept yet, old man,” he said aloud.
paragraph.target: 「しかし、おじいさん、まだ眠っていないね」と彼は声に出して言った。

paragraph.source: “It is half a day and a night and now another day and you have not slept.
paragraph.target: 「半日と夜が明け、今はもう一日が経っている。眠っていない。

paragraph.source: You must devise a way so that you sleep a little if he is quiet and steady.
paragraph.target: もし彼が静かで安定しているなら、少し眠れるように工夫しなければならない。

paragraph.source: If you do not sleep you might become unclear in the head.”
paragraph.target: 眠らないと、頭がぼんやりしてしまうかもしれない」と。

paragraph.source: I'm clear enough in the head, he thought.
paragraph.target: 頭は十分に冴えている、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: Too clear. I am as clear as the stars that are my brothers.
paragraph.target: あまりにも冴えすぎている。私は、兄弟である星々と同じくらいに冴えている。

paragraph.source: Still I must sleep. They sleep and the moon and the sun sleep and even the ocean sleeps sometimes on certain days when there is no current and a flat calm.
paragraph.target: それでも眠らねばならない。彼らは眠り、月や太陽も眠り、時には流れもなく穏やかな日には海も眠る。

paragraph.source: But remember to sleep, he thought.
paragraph.target: でも眠ることを忘れるな、彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: Make yourself do it and devise some simple and sure way about the lines.
paragraph.target: 自分に眠るようにさせ、綱について簡単で確実な方法を考えろ。

paragraph.source: Now go back and prepare the dolphin.
paragraph.target: さあ、戻ってイルカを準備しろ。

paragraph.source: It is too dangerous to rig the oars as a drag if you must sleep.
paragraph.target: 眠らねばならないなら、オールを引きずりとして使うのは危険すぎる。

paragraph.source: I could go without sleeping, he told himself.
paragraph.target: 眠らずにいられるかもしれない、彼は自分に言い聞かせた。

paragraph.source: But it would be too dangerous.
paragraph.target: しかし、それはあまりに危険だろう。

paragraph.source: He started to work his way back to the stern on his hands and knees, being careful not to jerk against the fish.
paragraph.target: 彼は手と膝で船尾に戻る作業を始めた。魚にぶつからないように気をつけながら。

paragraph.source: He may be half asleep himself, he thought.
paragraph.target: 自分も半分眠っているかもしれない、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: But I do not want him to rest. He must pull until he dies.
paragraph.target: しかし彼に休むことはさせたくない。彼は死ぬまで引かねばならない。

paragraph.source: Back in the stern he turned so that his left hand held the strain of the line across his shoulders and drew his knife from its sheath with his right hand.
paragraph.target: 船尾に戻った老人は、左手で肩越しにラインの張りを保ち、右手で鞘からナイフを抜いた。

paragraph.source: The stars were bright now and he saw the dolphin clearly and he pushed the blade of his knife into his head and drew him out from under the stern.
paragraph.target: 星は明るく、老人はイルカをはっきりと見て、ナイフの刃を頭に押し込み、船尾の下から引き上げた。

paragraph.source: He put one of his feet on the fish and slit him quickly from the vent up to the tip of his lower jaw.
paragraph.target: 老人は魚の一方の足を載せ、急いで腹部から下顎の先まで切り裂いた。

paragraph.source: Then he put his knife down and gutted him with his right hand, scooping him clean and pulling the gills clear.
paragraph.target: そして、ナイフを置いて右手で内臓を取り出し、丁寧に洗い、エラを取り除いた。

paragraph.source: He felt the maw heavy and slippery in his hands and he slit it open.
paragraph.target: 老人は手に重くて滑りやすい魚の胃袋を感じ、それを裂いた。

paragraph.source: There were two flying fish inside.
paragraph.target: 中には2匹のトビウオが入っていた。

paragraph.source: They were fresh and hard and he laid them side by side and dropped the guts and the gills over the stern.
paragraph.target: それらは新鮮で硬く、老人はそれらを並べて船尾に内臓とエラを捨てた。

paragraph.source: The dolphin was cold and a leprous gray-white now in the starlight and the old man skinned one side of him while he held his right foot on the fish's head.
paragraph.target: イルカは冷たく、星明かりの中で白っぽい灰色になっており、老人は片側の皮を剥ぎながら、右足で魚の頭を押さえていた。

paragraph.source: Then he turned him over and skinned the other side and cut each side off from the head down to the tail.
paragraph.target: そして、イルカをひっくり返し、もう片側の皮を剥ぎ、頭から尾まで両側を切り取った。

paragraph.source: He slid the carcass overboard and looked to see if there was any swirl in the water.
paragraph.target: 彼は死骸を船外に滑らせ、水中に渦がないか見た。

paragraph.source: But there was only the light of its slow descent.
paragraph.target: しかし、水中にはゆっくりと沈んでいく光しかなかった。

paragraph.source: He turned then and placed the two flying fish inside the two fillets of fish and putting his knife back in its sheath, he worked his way slowly back to the bow.
paragraph.target: そして彼は振り返り、2枚の切り身の中に2匹のトビウオを入れ、ナイフを鞘に収め、ゆっくりと船首に戻っていった。

paragraph.source: His back was bent with the weight of the line across it and he carried the fish in his right hand.
paragraph.target: 背中は糸の重さで曲がり、右手には魚を持っていた。

paragraph.source: Back in the bow he laid the two fillets of fish out on the wood with the flying fish beside them.
paragraph.target: 船首に戻り、彼は木の上に2枚の魚のフィレを並べ、その横に飛び魚を置いた。

paragraph.source: After that he settled the line across his shoulders in a new place and held it again with his left hand resting on the gunwale.
paragraph.target: その後、彼は糸を新しい場所に肩にかけ、再び左手で舷側に休ませながら保持した。

paragraph.source: Then he leaned over the side and washed the flying fish in the water, noting the speed of the water against his hand.
paragraph.target: そして彼は舷側に身を乗り出し、飛び魚を水で洗い、水の速さを手に感じた。

paragraph.source: His hand was phosphorescent from skinning the fish and he watched the flow of the water against it.
paragraph.target: 手は魚を剥いだことで蛍光を放ち、彼はその手に対する水の流れを見つめた。

paragraph.source: The flow was less strong and as he rubbed the side of his hand against the planking of the skiff, particles of phosphorus floated off and drifted slowly astern.
paragraph.target: 流れは弱まり、彼が手の側面を小舟の舷材にこすりつけると、リンの粒子が浮かび上がり、ゆっくりと船尾に漂流していった。

paragraph.source: “He is tiring or he is resting,” the old man said.
paragraph.target: 「彼は疲れているか、休んでいるかだ」と老人は言った。

paragraph.source: “Now let me get through the eating of this dolphin and get some rest and a little sleep.”
paragraph.target: 「さあ、このイルカを食べ終えて、休んで少し眠ろう」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: Under the stars and with the night colder all the time he ate half of one of the dolphin fillets and one of the flying fish, gutted and with its head cut off.
paragraph.target: 星の下で、夜がますます冷える中、彼はイルカのフィレの半分と、内臓を取り頭を切り落とした飛ぶ魚の一匹を食べた。

paragraph.source: “What an excellent fish dolphin is to eat cooked,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「イルカは調理して食べると素晴らしい魚だ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “And what a miserable fish raw.
paragraph.target: 「そして生の状態ではどれほどみじめな魚か。

paragraph.source: I will never go in a boat again without salt or limes.”
paragraph.target: 二度と塩やライムを持たずに船に乗ることはないだろう」と。

paragraph.source: If I had brains I would have splashed water on the bow all day and drying, it would have made salt, he thought.
paragraph.target: もし頭があれば、一日中船首に水をかけて乾かしていれば、塩ができたのに、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: But then I did not hook the dolphin until almost sunset.
paragraph.target: しかし、夕日近くまでイルカを釣ることができなかった。

paragraph.source: Still it was a lack of preparation.
paragraph.target: それでも、それは準備不足だった。

paragraph.source: But I have chewed it all well and I am not nauseated.
paragraph.target: しかし、よく噛んで食べたので吐き気はしない。

paragraph.source: The sky was clouding over to the east and one after another the stars he knew were gone.
paragraph.target: 空は東の方で曇り始め、彼が知っている星々が次々と消えていった。

paragraph.source: It looked now as though he were moving into a great canyon of clouds and the wind had dropped.
paragraph.target: 今、彼は巨大な雲の峡谷に進んでいるように見え、風も収まっていた。

paragraph.source: “There will be bad weather in three or four days,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「3日か4日後に悪天候がやってくるだろう」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “But not tonight and not tomorrow.
paragraph.target: しかし、今夜も明日も大丈夫だ。

paragraph.source: Rig now to get some sleep, old man, while the fish is calm and steady.”
paragraph.target: 老人よ、今船を整えて眠るがいい。魚は穏やかで安定しているから。」

paragraph.source: He held the line tight in his right hand and then pushed his thigh against his right hand as he leaned all his weight against the wood of the bow.
paragraph.target: 彼は右手で糸をしっかりと握り、その後、右手に太ももを押し当て、全体重を船首の木に預けた。

paragraph.source: Then he passed the line a little lower on his shoulders and braced his left hand on it.
paragraph.target: そして、糸を少し下に通して肩にかけ、左手をそれに預けた。

paragraph.source: My right hand can hold it as long as it is braced, he thought.
paragraph.target: 右手が支えられている限り、持ち続けられるだろう、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: If it relaxes in sleep my left hand will wake me as the line goes out.
paragraph.target: 眠りにゆるんだら、左手が糸が出るのを感じて私を起こすだろう。

paragraph.source: It is hard on the right hand.
paragraph.target: 右手にはきつい。

paragraph.source: But he is used to punishment.
paragraph.target: しかし、彼は罰を受けることに慣れている。

paragraph.source: Even if I sleep twenty minutes or a half an hour it is good.
paragraph.target: たとえ20分や30分眠ってもいい。

paragraph.source: He lay forward cramping himself against the line with all of his body, putting all his weight onto his right hand, and he was asleep.
paragraph.target: 彼は前に倒れ、体全体で糸に圧迫をかけ、全体重を右手にかけて眠りについた。

paragraph.source: He did not dream of the lions but instead of a vast school of porpoises that stretched for eight or ten miles
paragraph.target: 彼はライオンの夢を見るのではなく、8〜10マイルに及ぶ広大なイルカの群れの夢を見た

paragraph.source: and it was in the time of their mating and they would leap high into the air and return into the same hole they had made in the water when they leaped.
paragraph.target: それはイルカたちの交尾の時期であり、彼らは空高く跳び上がり、水中に跳ぶ際に作った同じ穴に戻っていくのだった。

paragraph.source: Then he dreamed that he was in the village on his bed and there was a norther and he was very cold and his right arm was asleep because his head had rested on it instead of a pillow.
paragraph.target: そして、彼は村のベッドにいて、北風が吹いてとても寒かった。彼の右腕は枕に頭を置く代わりに休んでいたために眠っていました。

paragraph.source: After that he began to dream of the long yellow beach and he saw the first of the lions come down onto it in the early dark and then the other lions came and he rested his chin on the wood of the bows where the ship lay anchored with the evening off-shore breeze and he waited to see if there would be more lions and he was happy.
paragraph.target: その後、彼は長い黄色い砂浜の夢を見始め、最初のライオンが早い暗闇の中に降りてくるのを見ました。そして他のライオンたちもやってきて、彼は船が夕方の沖風で停泊している船首の木に顎を乗せ、もしもっとライオンが現れるかを待ちながら、幸せでした。

paragraph.source: The moon had been up for a long time but he slept on and the fish pulled on steadily and the boat moved into the tunnel of clouds.
paragraph.target: 月はずっと昇っていたが、彼は眠り続け、魚は着実に引っ張り、船は雲のトンネルに進んでいった。

paragraph.source: He woke with the jerk of his right fist coming up against his face and the line burning out through his right hand.
paragraph.target: 彼は右拳が顔に当たり、糸が右手を通り抜ける感覚で目を覚ました。

paragraph.source: He had no feeling of his left hand but he braked all he could with his right and the line rushed out.
paragraph.target: 左手には感覚がなかったが、右手で全力でブレーキをかけ、糸は急速に走り出した。

paragraph.source: Finally his left hand found the line and he leaned back against the line and now it burned his back and his left hand, and his left hand was taking all the strain and cutting badly.
paragraph.target: ついに左手が糸を見つけ、彼は糸に寄りかかり、今度は背中と左手を焼き、左手はすべての負荷を受け止め、ひどく切れていた。

paragraph.source: He looked back at the coils of line and they were feeding smoothly.
paragraph.target: 彼は糸の巻き取りを振り返り、それが滑らかに進んでいるのを見た。

paragraph.source: Just then the fish jumped making a great bursting of the ocean and then a heavy fall.
paragraph.target: その時、魚が飛び跳ね、海が大きく破裂し、重い落下を見せた。

paragraph.source: Then he jumped again and again and the boat was going fast although line was still racing out and the old man was raising the strain to breaking point and raising it to breaking point again and again.
paragraph.target: そして魚は何度も跳ね、糸がまだ走り出しているにもかかわらず、船は速く進んでいき、老人は負荷を限界まで高め、何度も限界まで高めた。

paragraph.source: He had been pulled down tight onto the bow and his face was in the cut slice of dolphin and he could not move.
paragraph.target: 彼は弓にしっかりと引き寄せられ、顔はイルカの切り身の中にあり、動くことができなかった。

paragraph.source: This is what we waited for, he thought.
paragraph.target: これが待ち望んでいたものだ、彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: So now let us take it.
paragraph.target: だから、これを手に入れよう。

paragraph.source: Make him pay for the line, he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼に糸の代償を払わせよう、彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: Make him pay for it.
paragraph.target: 彼にそれを払わせよう。

paragraph.source: He could not see the fish's jumps but only heard the breaking of the ocean and the heavy splash as he fell.
paragraph.target: 彼は魚の飛び跳ねる様子は見えなかったが、ただ海の割れる音と、重い水しぶきが聞こえてきた。

paragraph.source: The speed of the line was cutting his hands badly but he had always known this would happen and he tried to keep the cutting across the calloused parts and not let the line slip into the palm nor cut the fingers.
paragraph.target: 糸の速度が彼の手をひどく傷つけていたが、彼はいつもこれが起こるだろうと知っていた。彼は、手の硬くなった部分に糸が切れるように保ち、糸が手のひらに滑り込まないようにし、指を切らないようにしていた。

paragraph.source: If the boy was here he would wet the coils of line, he thought.
paragraph.target: もし少年がここにいたら、糸の巻きを湿らせてくれるだろうな、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: Yes.
paragraph.target: そうだ。

paragraph.source: If the boy were here.
paragraph.target: もし少年がここにいたら。

paragraph.source: If the boy were here.
paragraph.target: もし少年がここにいたら。

paragraph.source: The line went out and out and out but it was slowing now and he was making the fish earn each inch of it.
paragraph.target: 糸はどんどん出ていきましたが、今は遅くなっており、彼は魚にそれぞれのインチを稼がせていました。

paragraph.source: Now he got his head up from the wood and out of the slice of fish that his cheek had crushed.
